definitions: A group of words taken from a text or speech and repeated by someone other than the original author or speaker.
A short musical passage or visual image taken from one piece of music or work of art and used in another.
The action of quoting from a text, speech, piece of music, or work of art.
A formal statement setting out the estimated cost for a particular job or service.
A price offered by a market-maker for the sale or purchase of a stock or other security.
A registration granted to a company enabling their shares to be officially listed and traded.
